entries.meaning: A vocalization similar to a cat's purring.
examples: A different vocalization, a girn, simiular to a cat's purring, was observed in infants reunited with their mothers...

verbs.description: girn (third-person singular simple present girns, present participle girning, simple past and past participle girned)

examples: At seventy-five or eighty I will be like a child myself, frail and cantankerous, a girning, burdensome old devil.

entries.meaning: (Scotland, Northern England) To whinge, moan, complain.
examples: And Jim was just girning all the time. I telled him to shut it.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make elaborate unnatural and distorted faces as a form of amusement or in a girning competition.
